message.content:
1. Thirty-three patients are undergoing high-risk surgery.
2. The patients were randomized into two groups.
3. One group is a control group.
4. The control group is referred to as group C.
5. Group C consists of 16 patients.
6. The other group is an intervention group.
7. The intervention group is referred to as group I.
8. Group I consists of 17 patients.

messages.content:
Statement: Thirty-three patients undergoing high-risk surgery were randomized either to a control group (group C, n = 16) or to an intervention group (group I, n = 17).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
